<description type="note">Title: The trial of Christ and the thieves before Pilate.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>
[The Trial of Christ and the Thieves before Pilate]

here þe jewys bryng jhesus A?en to pylat. ius doctor Sere pylat gode tydandys þou here of me Of herowd þe kyng þou hast good wyl And jhesus he sendyth A?en to the And byddyth þe chese hym to save or spylle. ijus doctor ?a ser all þe poer lyth now in þe and þou knowyst oure feyth he hath ner schent þou knowyst what myschef þer of may be we charge þe to gyf hym jwgement. Pylat Serys trewly ?e be to blame Jhesus þus to bete dyspoyle or bynde or put hym to so gret schame ffor no defawth in hym I fynde. Ne herowdys nother to whom I sent ?ow defawte in hym cowde fynde ryth non but sent hym A?en to me be ?ow As ?e knowe wel everychon. Ther fore vndyrstande what I xal say ?e knowe þe custom is in þis londe of ?our pasche day þat is ner honde what þeff or tretore be in bonde with-out Any price for worchep of þat xal go fre Away Now þan me thynkyth it were ryth to lete jhesus now go qwyte And do to hym no mo dyspyte serys þis is myn A-vyse I wolde wete what ?e say. here Alle þei xul cryen Nay nay nay. ius doctor delyvere us þe þeff barabas þat for mansclawth presonde was. Pylat What xal I þan with jhesu do Whethyr xal he A-byde or go. ijus doctor Jhesus xal on þe cros be don Crucifigatur we crye echon. pylat Serys what hath jhesus don A-mys Crucifigatur we sey At onys. populus clamabit. Pylat Serys syn Al gatys ?e wolyn so puttyn jhesu to wo and peyn jhesus A wyle with me xal go I wole hym examyne betwyx us tweyn. here pylat takyth jhesu and ledyth hym in to þe cowncel hous and seyth Jhesus what seys now lete se This matere now þou vndyrstonde In pes þou myth be for me but for þi pepyl of þi londe. Busshoppys and prestys of þe lawe þei love þe not as þou mayst se and þe comon pepyl A-?ens þe drawe In pes þou myth A be for me þis I telle þe pleyn. What seyst jhesus whi spekyst not me to knowyst not I haue power on þe cros þe to do And also I haue power to lete þe forth go what kanst þou here to seyn. Jhesus On me poer þou hast ryth non but þat my fadyr hath grawntyd be-forn I cam my faderys wyl to full-fylle þat mankynd xuld not spylle he þat hath betrayd me to þe at þis tyme his trespas is more þan is þine. ius doctor ?e pryncys and maysterys takyth hed and se how pylat in þis matere is favorabyl and þus oure lawys dystroyd myth be And to vs Alle vn-recurabyl. here pylat letyth jhesus A-lone and goth in to þe jewys and seyth Pylat Serys what wole ?e now with jhesu do I can fynde in hym but good it is my cownce ?e lete hym go it is rewthe spylle his blood. Cayphas Pylat me thynkyth þou dost gret wrong A?ens oure lawe þus to fortefye and þe pepyl here is so strong bryngyng þe lawful testymonye. Annas ?a and þou lete jhesu fro us pace þis we welyn up-holdyn Alle þou xalt Answere for his trespas and tretour to þe emperour we xal þe kalle. Pylat Now þan syn ?e wolne non other weye but in Alwyse þat jhesus must deye Artyse bryng me watyr I pray þe and what I wole do ?e xal se hic vnus afferet aquam. As I wasche with watyr my handys clene so gyltles of hese deth I mut ben. ius doctor þe blod of hym mut ben on vs et clamabunt ?a ?a ?a and on oure chyldyr Aftyr vs þan pylat goth A-?en to jhesu and bryngith hym þus seyng Pylat lo serys I bryng hym here to ?our presens þat ?e may knowe I fynde in hym non offens. ijus doctor dylyuere hym delyuere hym and lete us go on þe crosse þat he were do. pilat Serys wolde ?e ?our kyng I xulde on þe cros don. iijus doctor Sere we seyn þat we haue no kyng but þe emperour a-lon pilat Serys syn Al-gatys it must be so We must syt and our offyce do brynge forth to þe barre þat Arn to be dempt and þei xal haue here jugement. here þei brynge barabas to þe barre and jhesu and ij þewys in here shertys bare leggyd and jhesus standyng at þe barre be-twyx them and annas and cayphas xal gon in to þe cowncelle hous qwan pylat sytty[th.] Pylat Barabas hold up þi hond for here at þi delyvere dost þou stond and he halt up his honde Serys qwhat sey ?e of barabas thef and tretour bold xal he go fre or he xal be kept in holde. ius doctor Sere for þe solennyte of oure pasche day be oure lawe he xal go fre A-way. Pylat Barabas þan I dymysse þe and ?eve þe lycens to go fre et curret. dysmas and jesmas ther as ?e stondys þe lawe comawndyth ?ou to hald up ?our hondys Sere what sey ?e of þese theyvs tweyn. ijus doctor Sere þei ben both gylty we seyn. Pylat And what sey ?e of jhesu of nazareth. ius doctor Sere we sey he xal be put to deth. Pylat And kone ?e put A-?ens hym no trespas. ijus doctor Sere we wyl All þat he xal be put upon þe crosse. et clamabunt omnes voce magna dicentes ?a ?a ?a Pylat jhesu þin owyn pepyl han dysprevyd Al þat I haue for þe seyd or mevyd. I charge ?ou All at þe be-gynnyng As ?e wole Answere me be-forn þat þer be no man xal towch ?our kyng but yf he be knyght or jentylman born.
